item.title: Scatterplot
item.description: Scatterplots Another way to visually represent data is by using a scatterplot. A scatterplot is a type of plot or mathematical diagram using Cartesian coordinates to display values for typically two variables for a set of data. item.title: Time Series
item.description: Time Series The last way of visually representing data is through a time series plot. A time series plot displays values against time. They are similar to x-y graphs, but while an x-y graph can plot a variety of “x” variables (for example, height, weight, age), timeplots can only display time on the x-axis. Unlike pie charts and bar charts, these plots do not have categories. Timeplots are good for showing how data changes over time.
